comments.body: Removed `--quiet` to make it easier to debug package installation.

Without `--quiet`, pip install would output logs like this:

```
Requirement already satisfied: scipy in /usr/share/miniconda/envs/test-environment/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from -r ./dev/small-requirements.txt (line 2)) (1.5.4)
Requirement already satisfied: sqlalchemy>=1.3.21 in /usr/share/miniconda/envs/test-environment/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from -r ./dev/small-requirements.txt (line 5)) (1.4.15)
Collecting pytest==3.2.1
  Downloading pytest-3.2.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl (186 kB)
Collecting pytest-cov==2.6.0
  Downloading pytest_cov-2.6.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl (14 kB)
Collecting pytest-localserver==0.5.0
  Downloading pytest-localserver-0.5.0.tar.gz (20 kB)
Collecting moto!=2.0.7
  Downloading moto-2.0.6-py2.py3-none-any.whl (1.2 MB)
Collecting azure-storage-blob>=12.0.0
  Downloading azure_storage_blob-12.8.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl (345 kB)
Collecting py>=1.4.33
  Downloading py-1.10.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl (97 kB)
Requirement already satisfied: setuptools in /usr/share/miniconda/envs/test-environment/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pytest==3.2.1->-r ./dev/small-requirements.txt (line 7)) (52.0.0.post20210125)
```

This clarifies what installs what.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +44,48 @@  # remote host. See https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/8510.
  # As a workaround, we retry installation of large packages.
  retry-with-backoff pip install -r ./dev/small-requirements.txt
fi
if [[ "$INSTALL_SKINNY_PYTHON_DEPS" == "true" ]]; then

comments.body:
With this approach, we can:

- avoid installing the latest version of MLflow on PyPI and its dependencies
- avoid tweaking `tests/resources/mlflow-test-plugin/setup.py` so we can still use it as a plugin example
- test `mlflow-test-plugin` using the dev version of MLflow

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +60,64 @@
# Install `mlflow-test-plugin` without dependencies
pip install --no-dependencies tests/resources/mlflow-test-plugin

# Print current environment info

comments.body:
Confirmed the proposed change updates the pip version to the latest:

```
++ pip --version
pip 21.0.1 from /usr/share/miniconda/envs/test-environment/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pip (python 3.6)
```

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/runs/1860085508#step:4:245
And all the CI checks have passed :)

diffHunk:

pip install --upgrade pip
pip --version

if [[ "$MLFLOW_SKINNY" == "true" ]]; then

comments.body:
Nit:
Shall we use 
```
echo "Upgrade pip to version: `pip --version`"
```
to make it more clear ?

@WeichenXu123 Thanks for the comment. I think `pip install --upgrade pip` prints out something similar. What do you think?

```
++ pip install --upgrade pip
Requirement already satisfied: pip in /usr/share/miniconda/envs/test-environment/lib/python3.6/site-packages (20.3.3)
Collecting pip
  Downloading pip-21.0.1-py3-none-any.whl (1.5 MB)
Installing collected packages: pip
  Attempting uninstall: pip
    Found existing installation: pip 20.3.3
    Uninstalling pip-20.3.3:
      Successfully uninstalled pip-20.3.3
Successfully installed pip-21.0.1
++ pip --version
pip 21.0.1 from /usr/share/miniconda/envs/test-environment/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pip (python 3.6)
```
